title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest (film)
summary: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest is a 1975 American psychological comedy-drama film[4] directed by Milo≈° Forman, based on the 1962 novel of the same name by Ken Kesey. The film stars Jack Nicholson as Randle McMurphy, a new patient at a mental institution, and features a supporting cast of Louise Fletcher, Will Sampson, Danny DeVito, Sydney Lassick, William Redfield, as well as Christopher Lloyd and Brad Dourif in their film debuts.
